* Represents our Duke and contains the main program of Duke.
* Constructs the Duke with the filePath of storage.txt
* Runs the main program of the Duke.
* @param args necessary arguments demanded by the main method.
* Represents a specified command as AddCommand by extending the Command class.
* Adds various specified type of tasks into the taskList. e.g event
* with all components of the added task.
* @param commandType The commandType of the added task.
* @param description The description of the added task.
* @param ddl The due of the added task(if applicable).
* @param timePiece The time period of the added task.
public AddCommand(String commandType, String description, String ddl, String timePiece) {
* Lets the taskList of Duke add the task with the given information and
* updates content of storage file according to new taskList.
* Responses the result to user by using ui of Duke.
* @throws DukeException If exceptions occur when adding tasks or updating storage.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException{
ui.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
ui.println("Now you have " + tasks.getSize() + " tasks in the list.");
* Represents a command packaged by class Parser.
* Works as a parent class of more specified command classes in the package.
* @param commandType CommandType of the constructed command.
* Works as an empty method of parent class to be overridden.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Returns true if commandType is "exit" and false otherwise.
* Decides whether the loop in main method of Duke terminates.
* @return The boolean indicating whether quit the loop in main method.
* Represents a specified command as DeleteCommand by extending the Command class.
* Deletes the task with given index from the taskList of Duke.
* given the index of the task to be deleted.
* @param index The index of the task to be deleted.
* Lets the taskList of Duke delete the task with the given index and
* updates content of storage file according to new taskList.
* Responses the result to user by using ui of Duke.
* @throws DukeException If the index given is out of range.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! The index should be in range.");
ui.println("Now you have " + tasks.getSize() + " tasks in the list.");
* Represents a specified command as DoneCommand by extending the Command class.
* Marks the task with given index as done.
* given the index of the task to be marked as done.
* @param index The index of the task to be marked as done.
* Lets the taskList of Duke mark the task with the given index as done and
* updates content of storage file according to new taskList.
* Responses the result to user by using ui of Duke.
* @throws DukeException If the index given is out of range.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! The index should be in range.");
ui.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Represents a specified command as ExitCommand by extending the Command class.
* Terminates the loop in main method of Duke.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Represents a specified command as FindCommand by extending the Command class.
* Finds all tasks relevant with the searched keyword.
* Finds relevant tasks from taskList of Duke with the given keyword and
* responses the result to user by using ui of Duke.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Represents a specified command as ListCommand by extending the Command class.
* Lists all tasks in taskList of Duke.
* Lists all tasks in taskList of Duke by using ui of Duke.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.println("Ops, you haven't added any task!");
ui.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");

* Parses the time in String type into the Date type.
* The time string should follow the format: MM/dd/yyyy HHmm.

* Stores the content of taskList of Duke in a text file.

* Works as the parameter of the constructor of taskList.

* @throws DukeException If errors occur in loading process.

* Represents a specified task as Deadline by extending the Task class
